byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Paris, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.
byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Western diplomats involved in Iranian nuclear talks says country is increasingly resisting any form of formal framework agreement, wanting instead more general statement of understanding reached by deadline, followed by a final accord in June; if situation holds, it presents serious domestic political dilemma for Pres Obama.
lead_paragraph: If an agreement to limit Iran’s nuclear capability is reached by the deadline in the next seven days, one thing may be missing: an actual written accord, signed by the Iranians.

headline.main: In Nuclear Talks, Iran Seeks to Avoid Specifics
headline.print_headline: In Nuclear Talks, Iran Seeks to Avoid Specifics

snippet: If an agreement to limit Iran’s nuclear capability is reached by the deadline in the next seven days, one thing may be missing: an actual written accord, signed by the Iranians.
